title: COVID-19 Vaccines
cleaned_text: COVID-19 Vaccines COVID-19 vaccines are safe and effective. They are available for everyone aged six months and older. People who are up to date with their vaccines are optimally protected against severe illness and death from COVID. To make an appointment, visit [vaccines.gov](https://vaccines.gov), text your ZIP code to 438829 or call the Alaska COVID Helpline at 907-646-3322. Stay up to date Protect yourself and your community by staying up to date with your vaccines. COVID-19 vaccines are recommended for everyone 6 months and older. In most cases, adults and children aged 6 years and older should receive one bivalent mRNA dose. You may be eligible for additional bivalent COVID-19 vaccine doses if: - You are 65 years of age and older and got your first bivalent (updated) COVID-19 vaccine dose four or more months ago. - You are moderately or severely immunocompromised and received a bivalent (updated) COVID-19 vaccine dose two or more months ago. Learn more [Find Out If You're Up to Date on COVID-19 vaccines (CDC)](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/stay-up-to-date.html?CDC_AA_refVal=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cdc.gov%2Fcoronavirus%2F2019-ncov%2Fvaccines%2Fbooster-shot.html) [Learn more about COVID-19 vaccines (CDC)](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/index.html) [COVID-19 vaccines for immunocompromised people](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/recommendations/immuno.html) Find a COVID-19 vaccine provider For help finding a COVID vaccine provider or making an appointment, you may: - Visit [vaccines.gov](https://www.vaccines.gov/)to find appointments near you. - Text your ZIP code to 438829 or call 1-800-232-0233 to find vaccine locations near you. - Call the Alaska COVID Helpline at 907-646-3322 for assistance. Hours are 9 a.m. - 5 p.m. on weekdays. - Check with your local public health office, primary care provider, or local health authorities for more information. The Disability Information and Access Line (DIAL) helps people with disabilities get vaccinated. Call 888-677-1199 Monday-Friday from 5 a.m. to 4 p.m. or email [DIAL@n4a.org](mailto:DIAL@n4a.org). Immunization record requests If you need a copy of your immunization record, including COVID-19 vaccines, options include: - Download an electronic record from the [Docket app](http://www.docket.care/), - Request a paper copy by faxing or mailing an [Immunization Record Request Form (PDF)](https://health.alaska.gov/dph/Epi/iz/Documents/Immunization-Record-Request-Form.pdf)to the Alaska Immunization Program, or - Request records through your health care provider. See [How to Get Vaccination Records](https://health.alaska.gov/dph/Epi/iz/Pages/records.aspx) for more information.
